text: Theres no technical difference between how the email is sent out depending on the token so long as the domain is verified, rather than just the address. So I’m afraid I can’t really help more with that
Hey <@U01PJMZ5KPH> - thanks for responding but I dont see how this can be done with data/CSV _from a report_.
Hi, has anyone had the task to create more than 1000 Website pages in HubSpot during a page migration? i wonder what the best approach is to tackle such a huge task!
Hi Andreas, the best approach should be analyze the pages and create different templates.
It does look like the pages api allows you to create pages on the fly. <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/pages/post_pages>
Right, but this will cost the same as building pages in page editor. Actually, it's better to add content in the page editor, rather than building code for the content with apis
I believe the APIs can be used for app purposes, meaning that you can add pages outside HubSpot
scrape the site content and throw it all in a hubdb table for dynamic pages. obviously the answer depends but that’s one approach.

Assuming you can format the pages you intend to create in some kind of generic data structure like a CSV - And the bulk of the pages follow a similar design. Using the API to do all of the heavy lifting would make building 1000 pages much faster than doing it by hand. Especially if you have a small team. But You would def need to clean up the page data - if it’s coming from wordpress it will be challenging to get the original page data the way you want it.

You could use the import tools we have in app for some of it:

Pages: <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/website-pages/import-your-website-structure-into-HubSpot>
Posts: <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/blog/import-your-blog-from-any-cms-with-smart-copy>

Back when I did a migration, I used ScreamingFrog to pull a list of URLs and then created a “Migration Spreadsheet Checklist” that had all the urls and then some columns like `url | type (blog, LP, page) | template | owner | content copied | new url | qa complete | approved`

helped with tracking it all.

Note, when doing the pages import, it will import the meta but not the actual content in the body of the page. As others have noted, the content can be tricky to import so it might help to have some kind of manual process for it.

cc <@UHM5BT6G5>

Hi All! I am looking for a developer to help me with some minor website tweaks. One, to have better page load time to one of our resource centers. Two, to add a search tool / category tool into our automated "all blogs" section of our blog. I would love to explain further and tackle this with someone ASAP?
Workflow question: Is there a way to set the deal amount based on a contact property "price"?
thanks to all of you for your help, really appreciate it!!
